intro: Diplusodon ulei, commonly known as the yellow star grass, is a flowering plant native to Africa and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, erect stems. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of grass species. Diplusodon ulei is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various insect species.
